quoteText: He who plants a tree, plants a hope
A society grows great when old men plant trees whose shade they know they shall never sit in.
The tree of silence bears the fruits of peace.
All birds will flock to a fruitful tree.
Do not cut down the tree that gives you shade.
If you want to be happy for a year, plant a garden; if you want to be happy for life, plant a tree.
A seed hidden in the heart of an apple is an orchard invisible.
Only when the last tree has died and the last river been poisoned and the last fish been caught will we realize we cannot eat money.
Don’t despise the seed, one day it will be a palm tree.
You don’t have to cut a tree down to get at the fruit.
Though a tree grows ever so high, the falling leaves return to its roots.
Any fool can count the seeds in an apple. Only God can count all the apples in one seed.
Praise be to you, Our Lord, through our Sister, Mother Earth, who sustains and governs us, and who produces various fruits, with colored flowers and herbs.
Taste every fruit of every tree in the garden at least once. It is an insult to creation not to experience it fully. Temperance is wickedness.
In an orchard there should be enough fruit to eat, enough to lay up, enough to be stolen, and enough to rot upon the ground.

Fruits each in its season, are the cheapest, most elegant and wholesome dessert  you can offer your family or friends, at luncheon or tea. Pastry and plum-pudding should be prohibited by law, from the beginning of June until the end of September.
With an apple I will astonish Paris.
Truth is a fruit that can only be picked when it is very ripe.
Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
When one has tasted watermelon he knows what the angels eat.
